doc.after: Mount Fuji, along with Mount Tate and Mount Haku, is one of Japan's "Three Holy Mountains". The kami of Mount Fuji is worshipped in the thousands Asama shrines in Japan, which head-shrine is the Fujisan HongÅ« Sengen Taisha. The physical Fuji is the shintai of the god Fuji. The mountain also represents the axis mundi.
